definition:
Suppose $X$ is a topological vector space, $X'$ is the continuous dual
of $X$, and $x_0,x_1,\ldots $ is a sequence in $X$. Then we say that
$x_i$ *converges weakly* to $x\in X$ if
$$\lim_{i\to \infty} f(x_i) = f(x)$$ for every $f\in X'$. The notation
for this is $x_i \xrightarrow[]{w} x$.
